metadata.notes: Digital health company, Director-level analytics leadership. Strong fit on leadership, governance, cross-functional work, team management. Gap: no Tableau experience (have Sigma, Spotfire, Sigma). EST zone - matches.

summary: Analytics leader with 10+ years of progressive experience building and scaling data teams, establishing data governance frameworks, and driving data-driven decision-making across complex organizations. Proven track record of partnering with cross-functional stakeholders to translate data into actionable business insights, combined with hands-on technical depth in Python, SQL, and predictive modeling. Experienced in hiring, mentoring, and developing analyst teams while maintaining accountability for data quality, governance, and strategic alignment with business objectives.

experience.title: Director, Data Strategy & Analytics
bullets: Lead analytics strategy and delivery for a life science platform serving pharmaceutical clients, partnering directly with product and go-to-market teams to define data requirements and translate analytics outputs into client-facing insights
Built risk-scoring models from scratch using company and client data, designing the full pipeline from data ingestion and cleaning through model development and operationalization

Designed a reference data architecture to harmonize data from multiple sources into a unified framework, resolving complex data quality challenges including cross-source matching and inference of missing values
Developed a Python library for generating standardized analytics visualizations, reducing manual effort and ensuring consistency across client deliverables and conference presentations

experience.title: Consulting Data Scientist
bullets: Delivered end-to-end predictive modeling engagements for clients across multiple industries, managing full project lifecycle from scoping and stakeholder alignment through deployment and iteration
Built a production random forest classification model for a SaaS platform that runs nightly, maintaining and iterating on the model post-launch
Worked directly with client stakeholders including VP-level leadership and engineering teams, translating complex model outputs into actionable business recommendations

experience.title: Director, Data & Analytics (Medical Affairs)
bullets: Defined and executed enterprise data and analytics strategy, serving as strategic advisor to senior leadership and aligning analytics initiatives with organizational priorities
Led development of a centralized data lake as the single source of truth for analytics and reporting, establishing scalable infrastructure for data-driven decision-making
Managed the internal analytics team responsible for building custom dashboards and reports in Spotfire, overseeing hiring, onboarding, and performance development
Established data governance frameworks and wrote formal data requirements to ensure data quality, consistency, and transparency across the organization
Managed vendors and internal teams to deliver analytics solutions on time and within budget

experience.title: Associate Director, Digital & Data Science
bullets: Led the digital and data science group and the statistical monitoring group, providing cross-functional analytics leadership and team mentorship
Partnered with manufacturing and quality stakeholders to implement predictive modeling programs, translating complex model outputs into actionable quality decisions
Led semi-annual Annual Product Quality Review meetings, presenting data-driven assessments to cross-functional executive leadership
Served as Spotfire system administrator and built real-time process and quality monitoring dashboards

experience.title: Senior Process Data Scientist
bullets: Developed and deployed predictive models for biopharmaceutical manufacturing including automated limit calculations, feed quantity optimization, and product quality prediction
Built and maintained automated data pipelines to ingest, clean, and transform process data into analysis-ready formats
Presented modeling results and strategic recommendations to senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders
Promoted from Data Scientist to Senior Data Scientist based on expanded technical leadership and modeling scope

cover_letter.opening: I am writing to express my interest in the Director, Analytics role at Hello Heart. With over a decade of experience leading analytics teams, establishing data governance frameworks, and driving data-driven decision-making across complex organizations, I am drawn to Hello Heart's mission to democratize preventive heart health and excited by the opportunity to build and scale the analytics function at a company with clear product-market fit and significant growth ahead.
body: My experience maps directly to the core responsibilities of this role. At Gilead Sciences, I served as Director of Data & Analytics, where I defined enterprise analytics strategy, built a centralized data lake, managed the internal analytics team through hiring and performance development, and established data governance frameworks - all while serving as a strategic advisor to senior leadership. At Takeda, I led both the digital and data science group and the statistical monitoring function, partnering closely with manufacturing and quality stakeholders to translate complex analytics into business decisions. Across both roles, I was responsible for ensuring data quality, aligning analytics with organizational priorities, and developing the analysts on my teams.

I am particularly interested in the cross-functional partnership and analytics guild model this role describes. Throughout my career, I have consistently operated as a bridge between technical teams and business stakeholders - translating data into language that drives decisions, not just reports. At Redica Systems, I work directly with product and go-to-market teams to define what analytics they need and deliver it in a form that is immediately actionable. I have built analytics infrastructure from the ground up multiple times, including data pipelines, governance policies, and visualization tooling, and I am comfortable owning both the strategic vision and the hands-on execution.

Hello Heart's position at the intersection of digital health, preventive care, and employer-sponsored benefits represents an exciting challenge. I would welcome the opportunity to discuss how my background in analytics leadership and cross-functional execution can contribute to scaling the data-driven culture you are building.
cover_letter.closing: Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to the possibility of discussing this role and Hello Heart's analytics vision in more detail.
